title: forsyth-observable
text: This is a Quarto website. To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites. ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.1 ── ✓ ggplot2 3.3.5.9000 ✓ purrr 0.3.4.9000 ✓ tibble 3.1.5.9000 ✓ dplyr 1.0.7.9000 ✓ tidyr 1.1.4.9000 ✓ stringr 1.4.0.9000 ✓ readr 1.4.0 ✓ forcats 0.5.1 ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── x dplyr::between() masks data.table::between() x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() x dplyr::first() masks data.table::first() x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() x dplyr::last() masks data.table::last() x purrr::transpose() masks data.table::transpose() [1] 4 Now to try Observable Plot.plot({ y: { grid: true, label: "Percent of Population Fully Vaccinated" }, marks: [ Plot.line(filtered, { x: "Date", y: "Series_Complete_Pop_Pct", stroke: "County"}), Plot.text(filtered, Plot.selectLast({ x: "Date", y: "Series_Complete_Pop_Pct", z: "County", text: "County", textAnchor: "Series_Complete_Pop_Pct", dx:3, dy: 3 })), ] }) data = FileAttachment('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/medewitt/covidcdc/main/output/nc-county-vax.csv').csv({ typed: true }) viewof intensity = Inputs.range([0, 500], {step: 1, label: "Days"}) viewof islands = Inputs.select(data.map(d => d.County), { multiple: true, label: "County", sort: true, unique: true}) islands filtered = data.filter(function(data) { return islands.includes(data.County); }) import { aq, op } from '@uwdata/arquero' penguins = await aq.loadCSV('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/medewitt/covidcdc/main/output/nc-county-vax.csv') viewof datUse = penguins //.filter(p => islands.includes(p.County)) .groupby('County') .slice(0,intensity) .view(intensity); Plot.plot({ y: { grid: true, label: "Percent of Population Fully Vaccinated" }, marks: [ Plot.line(datUse.indices(), {x: datUse.column("Date"), y: datUse.column("Series_Complete_Pop_Pct"), stroke: datUse.column("County")}) ], caption: html`Figure 1. This chart has a fancy caption.` })
